title: What are lead acid batteries used for? - Quora

response.answer_text: Car batteries (starting, lighting and ignition). Golf carts. Powered wheelchairs. Solar power. Batteries for camping, caravanning and recreational vehicles. Marine batteries. Back up batteries for UPS systems and emergency lighting. Fire and security alarm backup batteries. Portable target mechanisms for firing ranges. Temporary traffic signals. Motorcycle batteries. Starter batteries for emergency on’-line generator systems. Backup batteries for cellular telephone masts. Backup batteries for telephone exchanges. The list above is certainly not exhaustive, but is a good start.

“Lead acid batteries were invented in 1859 by Gaston Planté and first demonstrated to the French Academy of Sciences in 1860. They remain the technology of choice for automotive SLI (Starting, Lighting and Ignition) applications because they are robust, tolerant to abuse, tried and tested and because of their low cost.” Low internal impedance, high output current on demand Robust, reliable, abusable Indefinite shelf life if stored dry Holds charge over long inactive periods Tolerates continuous trickle charge Major uses are in automotive and traction, stationary engines, submarines, backup storage…. High recycled content
